{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with primary amenorrhea, short stature, webbed neck, widely spaced nipples, weak pulses in the lower extremities, streak ovaries, raised FSH, and no oocyte in the histology of the ovary. These findings are consistent with Turner syndrome (45XO). Turner syndrome is characterized by the absence of one X chromosome in females. The most likely karyotype in this patient is 45XO.", "answer_choice": "A. 45XO"}
